intro: Chondrorhyncha maculata, commonly known as the spotted liverwort, is a non-vascular plant belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its compact, thallus-like structure with a distinct central axis and lateral lobes. The plant exhibits a greenish to reddish coloration, often with dark spots or markings on its surface. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found on rocks or soil in temperate regions. Chondrorhyncha maculata plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms.
